snippet: Fewer prominent voices are able to make the case for a systemic overhaul that would encourage private enterprise and foster a shift toward a more consumer-driven economy.
abstract: Chinese government has moved to limit public debate on economic policy, shutting out voices for change; a broad consensus of Chinese economists says the country is overdue for a big push to encourage private enterprise and a shift toward a more consumer-driven economy; change seems unlikely as publicly controlled enterprises have become increasingly lucrative, generating wealth and privileges for hundreds of thousands of Communist Party members and their families.
lead_paragraph: Fewer prominent voices are able to make the case for a systemic overhaul that would encourage private enterprise and foster a shift toward a more consumer-driven economy.

headline.seo: In Shift, China Stifles Debate on Economic Change
headline.main: China Closes Window on Economic Debate, Protecting Dominance of State
headline.print_headline: China Closes Window on Economic Debate, Protecting Dominance of State
